result.execSummary:
The defendant Dormaine D Merriweather was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 4 days time served, with Huber privileges for work and child care.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No firearm; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling AND a parenting course.
Establish paternity, and start the process within 1 week for all his children.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on November 6, 2015.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for ZERO days time served with Huber privileges for work and child care.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on november 6, 2015.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dormaine D Merriweather in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served, with huber privileges for work and child care.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 MONTHS.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for ZERO days time served with huber privileges for work and child care.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 MONTHS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling AND a parenting course.
-Establish paternity, and start the process within 1 week for all his children.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

AS TO COUNTS 1 (as amended) & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Defendant Dormaine D Merriweather in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for Kristin Schrank for  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information and waives formal reading.
AS TO COUNT 1:  
Court ordered charge amended to misdemeanor battery, domestic abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 973.055(1) a Class A misdemeanor.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dormaine D Merriweather in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

15RM028625  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-09-15
Same conditions to apply.

Defendant Dormaine D Merriweather in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE RECALLED.  Defendant tested positive for THC again.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court ordered cash bail set at $200.00.

Defendant Dormaine D Merriweather in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court admonished the defendant regarding his positive THC test and advised him that any further positive tests may result in higher cash bail.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm
Defendant's Preliminary Motions In Limine and Pretrial Motions received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

BRANCH 4 (FLANAGAN)  FOR  BRANCH 40 (DALLET)
Defendant Dormaine D Merriweather in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defense received discovery. Court ordered Defendant to comply with JusticePoint and all conditions of bail, including no possession of any firearms or weapons; ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; and to have no contact with the victim. Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Laurel S

Defendant Dormaine D Merriweather in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Dormaine D Merriweather in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing May 26, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 40.
